thread.title: SAISD selects seven for athletic hall of fame

author: Terrence Thomas
title: SAISD selects seven for athletic hall of fame
text:
Photo: Marvin Pfeiffer /San 6 Caption

Christi Cano, former LPGA player and city amateur champion with kids in a Alamo City Golf Trail spring break junior clinic at San Pedro Driving Range on March 11, 2013. Kathleen Lovejoy, former secretary to Claud Kellam, stands by a copy of his SAISD Athletic Hall of Fame induction ceremony plaque at the Plaza Club on Feb. 21, 2015. Former Brackenridge High School standout and former NFL player Warren McVea posse for a portriat with a picture from his days as an Eagles star in 1964. Photo: Express-News File Photo Image 6 of 6 Gary Green and Gabe Rivera (right) get together after being honored in a pregame ceremony as Sam Houston plays Jefferson at Alamo Stadium on Sept. 27, 2014. Gary Green and Gabe Rivera (right) get together after being honored in a pregame ceremony as Sam Houston plays Jefferson at Alamo Stadium on Sept. 27, 2014. Photo: Tom Reel /San Antonio Express-News SAISD selects seven for athletic hall of fame 1 / 6 Back to Gallery Two state championship-winning coaches, two legendary football players, a state-champion golfer, a Title IX advocate and a longtime athletic department secretary will be inducted into the 2016 SAISD Athletic Hall of Fame.
Brackenridge’s Warren McVea and Jefferson’s Gabe Rivera , who both played in the NFL, former Edison golfer Christi Cano , former Sam Houston basketball coach Wayne Dickey , former Lanier basketball coach William “Nemo” Herrera , former assistant athletic director Dorothy Williams and longtime athletic secretary Kathleen Lovejoy will be honored Feb. 13 during a ceremony at the Sunset Station Depot 1.
The SAISD Athletic Hall of Fame recognizes alumni who have made a positive impact in sports. Inductees will receive a plaque to keep while another will be displayed on the Hall of Fame Wall located on the visitor’s side of Alamo Stadium.
